intro: Hymenoxys calva, commonly known as the hairy leaf sunflower, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes. It features hairy stems and leaves, with yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Hymenoxys calva is often found in the western United States and parts of Mexico.
